meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being sensitive.
meanings.sent1: Her sensitivity to others' feelings makes her a great friend.
meanings.sent2: His sensitivity to loud noises causes him discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The robot's sensitivity to emotions led to some hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The sensitivity of the situation required careful handling.
meanings.sent5: The artist's sensitivity to color made her paintings truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The ability to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences.
meanings.sent1: The dog's sensitivity to sound allowed it to hear approaching footsteps.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's equipment had high sensitivity to detect even the smallest particles.
meanings.sent3: The detective's sensitivity to clues helped solve the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: The sensitivity of the microphone picked up every whisper in the room.
meanings.sent5: The plant's sensitivity to light guided its growth towards the sun.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance or organism responds to a stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The patient's skin showed high sensitivity to the new medication.
meanings.sent2: The plant's sensitivity to water levels determined its growth rate.
meanings.sent3: The car's sensitivity to touch screen commands made driving more convenient.
meanings.sent4: The sensitivity of the thermometer allowed for precise temperature readings.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's sensitivity to changes in air pressure affected their performance.
